visualize_training_results.docstring:
Visualize training results with unified risk/accuracy ratio information.
    
    This function creates a comprehensive visualization of training metrics,
    including loss, accuracy, batch sizes, pattern recognition rates, risks,
    unified risk/accuracy ratios, learning rates, and more.
    
    Args:
        history (dict): Training history dictionary containing metrics
        output_path (str, optional): Path to save the visualization. If None,
                                    the visualization is only displayed.
visualize_training_results.code_snippet:
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

def visualize_training_results(history, output_path=None):
    """
    Visualize training results with unified risk/accuracy ratio information.
    
    This function creates a comprehensive visualization of training metrics,
    including loss, accuracy, batch sizes, pattern recognition rates, risks,
    unified risk/accuracy ratios, learning rates, and more.
    
    Args:
        history (dict): Training history dictionary containing metrics
        output_path (str, optional): Path to save the visualization. If None,
                                    the visualization is only displayed.
    """
    # Create figure with more subplots for EVE-specific metrics
    plt.figure(figsize=(15, 28))  # Increased figure height for more plots
    
    # Create epochs range
    epochs = range(1, len(history['train_loss']) + 1)
    
    # Plot arrangement
    num_rows = 8  # Increased from 7 to 8 rows to accommodate the augmentation plot
    num_cols = 2
    plot_idx = 1
    
    # 1. Training metrics: Loss
    plt.subplot(num_rows, num_cols, plot_idx)
    plot_idx += 1
    plt.plot(epochs, history['train_loss'], 'b-', label='Training Loss')
    if 'val_loss' in history and history['val_loss']:
        plt.plot(epochs, history['val_loss'], 'r-', label='Validation Loss')
    plt.title('Loss')
    plt.xlabel('Epoch')
    plt.ylabel('Loss')
    plt.legend()
    plt.grid(True)
    
    # 2. Training metrics: Accuracy
    plt.subplot(num_rows, num_cols, plot_idx)
    plot_idx += 1
    plt.plot(epochs, history['train_acc'], 'b-', label='Training Accuracy')
    if 'val_acc' in history and history['val_acc']:
        plt.plot(epochs, history['val_acc'], 'r-', label='Validation Accuracy')
    plt.title('Accuracy')
    plt.xlabel('Epoch')
    plt.ylabel('Accuracy (%)')
    plt.legend()
    plt.grid(True)
    
    # 3. Train/Test Accuracy Ratio
    plt.subplot(num_rows, num_cols, plot_idx)
    plot_idx += 1
    if 'train_acc' in history and 'val_acc' in history:
        ratios = [train/max(0.1, val) for train, val in zip(history['train_acc'], history['val_acc'])]
        plt.plot(epochs, ratios, 'g-o', label='Train/Test Ratio')
        plt.axhline(y=1.0, color='r', linestyle='--', label='Ideal Ratio (1.0)')
        plt.title('Train/Test Accuracy Ratio')
        plt.xlabel('Epoch')
        plt.ylabel('Ratio')
        plt.legend()
        plt.grid(True)
    else:
        plt.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No accuracy data available',
                horizontalalignment='center', verticalalignment='center')
        plt.title('Train/Test Accuracy Ratio')
    
    # 4. Batch sizes
    plt.subplot(num_rows, num_cols, plot_idx)
    plot_idx += 1
    plt.plot(epochs, history['batch_sizes'], 'g-o', label='Batch Size')
    plt.title('Batch Size')
    plt.xlabel('Epoch')
    plt.ylabel('Batch Size')
    plt.grid(True)
    
    # 5. Pattern recognition rates
    plt.subplot(num_rows, num_cols, plot_idx)
    plot_idx += 1
    if 'pattern_recognition_rates' in history and history['pattern_recognition_rates']:
        # Extract pattern types and create separate lines for each
        pattern_types = set()
        for rates in history['pattern_recognition_rates']:
            pattern_types.update(rates.keys())
        
        for pattern_type in pattern_types:
            rates = [epoch_rates.get(pattern_type, 0) for epoch_rates in history['pattern_recognition_rates']]
            # Only plot if we have enough data points
            if len(rates) >= len(epochs):
                plt.plot(epochs[:len(rates)], rates, marker='o', alpha=0.7, label=pattern_type)
            else:
                # Pad with zeros if needed
                padded_rates = [0] * (len(epochs) - len(rates)) + rates
                plt.plot(epochs, padded_rates, marker='o', alpha=0.7, label=pattern_type)
        
        plt.title('Pattern Recognition Rates')
        plt.xlabel('Epoch')
        plt.ylabel('Recognition Rate')
        plt.legend(loc='lower right')
    else:
        # Fallback
        plt.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No pattern recognition data available', 
                horizontalalignment='center', verticalalignment='center')
        plt.title('Pattern Recognition Rates')
    
    plt.grid(True)
    
    # 6. Pattern risks (derived from accuracy)
    plt.subplot(num_rows, num_cols, plot_idx)
    plot_idx += 1
    if 'pattern_risks' in history and history['pattern_risks']:
        # Extract pattern types and create separate lines for each
        pattern_types = set()
        for risks in history['pattern_risks']:
            pattern_types.update(risks.keys())
        
        for pattern_type in pattern_types:
            risks = [epoch_risks.get(pattern_type, 0.5) for epoch_risks in history['pattern_risks']]
            # Only plot if we have enough data points
            if len(risks) >= len(epochs):
                plt.plot(epochs[:len(risks)], risks, marker='o', alpha=0.7, label=pattern_type)
            else:
                # Pad with default value (0.5) if needed
                padded_risks = [0.5] * (len(epochs) - len(risks)) + risks
                plt.plot(epochs, padded_risks, marker='o', alpha=0.7, label=pattern_type)
        
        plt.title('Pattern Risk Levels (Derived from Accuracy)')
        plt.xlabel('Epoch')
        plt.ylabel('Risk Level')
        plt.legend(loc='upper right')
    else:
        # Fallback
        plt.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No pattern risk data available', 
                horizontalalignment='center', verticalalignment='center')
        plt.title('Pattern Risk Levels')
    
    plt.grid(True)
    
    # 7. Unified Risk/Accuracy Ratios
    plt.subplot(num_rows, num_cols, plot_idx)
    plot_idx += 1
    if 'risk_accuracy_ratios' in history and history['risk_accuracy_ratios']:
        # Sort epochs
        epochs_list = sorted(history['risk_accuracy_ratios'].keys())
        
        # Extract pattern types
        pattern_types = set()
        for ratios in history['risk_accuracy_ratios'].values():
            pattern_types.update(ratios.keys())
        
        for pattern_type in pattern_types:
            ratios = []
            epochs_with_data = []
            
            for epoch in epochs_list:
                if pattern_type in history['risk_accuracy_ratios'][epoch]:
                    ratios.append(history['risk_accuracy_ratios'][epoch][pattern_type])
                    epochs_with_data.append(epoch + 1)  # 1-indexed epochs
            
            if ratios:
                plt.plot(epochs_with_data, ratios, marker='o', alpha=0.7, label=pattern_type)
        
        plt.title('Unified Risk/Accuracy Ratios')
        plt.xlabel('Epoch')
        plt.ylabel('Risk/Accuracy Ratio')
        plt.axhline(y=1.0, color='k', linestyle='--', alpha=0.5, label='Balanced (1.0)')
        plt.legend(loc='upper right')
        plt.grid(True)
    else:
        plt.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No unified ratio data available', 
                horizontalalignment='center', verticalalignment='center')
        plt.title('Unified Risk/Accuracy Ratios')
    
    # 8. Learning Rate
    plt.subplot(num_rows, num_cols, plot_idx)
    plot_idx += 1
    if 'learning_rates' in history and history['learning_rates']:
        plt.plot(epochs, history['learning_rates'], 'r-o', label='Learning Rate')
        plt.title('Learning Rate Adaptation')
        plt.xlabel('Epoch')
        plt.ylabel('Learning Rate')
        plt.yscale('log')  # Log scale often better for LR
        plt.grid(True)
        plt.legend()
    else:
        plt.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No learning rate data available', 
                horizontalalignment='center', verticalalignment='center')
        plt.title('Learning Rate Adaptation')
    
    # 9. Weight Adjustments
    plt.subplot(num_rows, num_cols, plot_idx)
    plot_idx += 1
    if 'weight_adjustments' in history and history['weight_adjustments']:
        # Extract pattern types for weight adjustments
        pattern_types = set()
        for weights in history['weight_adjustments']:
            pattern_types.update(weights.keys())
        
        for pattern_type in pattern_types:
            weights = []
            epochs_with_data = []
            
            for i, weights_data in enumerate(history['weight_adjustments']):
                if pattern_type in weights_data:
                    weights.append(weights_data[pattern_type])
                    epochs_with_data.append(i + 1)  # 1-indexed epochs
            
            if weights:
                plt.plot(epochs_with_data, weights, marker='o', alpha=0.7, label=pattern_type)
        
        plt.title('EVE Weight Adjustments by Pattern')
        plt.xlabel('Epoch')
        plt.ylabel('Weight Adjustment Factor')
        plt.axhline(y=1.0, color='k', linestyle='--', alpha=0.5, label='No Adjustment')
        plt.legend(loc='upper right')
        plt.grid(True)
    else:
        plt.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No weight adjustment data available', 
                horizontalalignment='center', verticalalignment='center')
        plt.title('EVE Weight Adjustments by Pattern')
    
    # 10. Pattern Equilibrium Bounds Visualization
    plt.subplot(num_rows, num_cols, plot_idx)
    plot_idx += 1
    if 'equilibrium_bounds_history' in history and history['equilibrium_bounds_history']:
        # Extract data for plotting
        epochs_list = sorted(history['equilibrium_bounds_history'].keys())
        
        # Get all pattern types
        pattern_types = set()
        for statuses in history['equilibrium_bounds_history'].values():
            pattern_types.update(statuses.keys())
        
        # Set up colors and markers
        colors = {'min': 'red', 'max': 'blue'}
        labels = {'min': 'Below Min', 'max': 'Above Max'}
        
        # Plot min and max bound violations separately
        for bound_type in ['min', 'max']:
            for pattern_type in pattern_types:
                # Create lists to hold the data points
                x_pts = []
                y_pts = []
                
                for epoch in epochs_list:
                    if pattern_type in history['equilibrium_bounds_history'][epoch]:
                        status = history['equilibrium_bounds_history'][epoch][pattern_type]
                        
                        # If it violates the bound (value is False), add a point
                        if bound_type in status and not status[bound_type]:
                            x_pts.append(epoch + 1)  # 1-indexed for display
                            # Offset points slightly based on pattern type for visibility
                            y_offset = list(pattern_types).index(pattern_type) * 0.1
                            y_pts.append(y_offset + (0 if bound_type == 'min' else 0.5))
                
                if x_pts:
                    plt.scatter(x_pts, y_pts, label=f"{pattern_type} {labels[bound_type]}", 
                               color=colors[bound_type], alpha=0.7, marker='o')
        
        plt.yticks([0.1, 0.6], ['Min Bound', 'Max Bound'])
        plt.title('Pattern Bound Violations')
        plt.xlabel('Epoch')
        plt.ylabel('Bound Type')
        plt.grid(True, axis='x')
        plt.legend(loc='best', fontsize='small')
    else:
        # Leave empty if not using bounds
        plt.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No equilibrium bounds data available',
                horizontalalignment='center', verticalalignment='center')
        plt.title('Pattern Bound Violations')
    
    # 11. Dataset Size
    plt.subplot(num_rows, num_cols, plot_idx)
    plot_idx += 1
    if 'dataset_sizes' in history and len(history['dataset_sizes']) > 1:
        plt.plot(range(len(history['dataset_sizes'])), history['dataset_sizes'], 'b-o', label='Dataset Size')
        plt.title('Dataset Size')
        plt.xlabel('Epoch')
        plt.ylabel('Number of Examples')
        plt.grid(True)
        plt.legend()
    else:
        plt.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No dataset size data available',
                horizontalalignment='center', verticalalignment='center')
        plt.title('Dataset Size')
    
    # 12. Memory Usage
    plt.subplot(num_rows, num_cols, plot_idx)
    plot_idx += 1
    if 'memory_usage' in history and history['memory_usage']:
        plt.plot(epochs, history['memory_usage'], 'm-o', label='Memory Usage')
        plt.title('GPU Memory Usage')
        plt.xlabel('Epoch')
        plt.ylabel('Memory (GB)')
        plt.grid(True)
        plt.legend()
    else:
        plt.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No memory usage data available',
                horizontalalignment='center', verticalalignment='center')
        plt.title('GPU Memory Usage')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    
    # Save figure if output path provided
    if output_path:
        plt.savefig(output_path)
        logger.info(f"Training visualization saved to: {output_path}")
    
    plt.close()
